newsitem.title: UK: Finsbury says to buy 20 pct of Lloyd's Wren.
newsitem.headline: Finsbury says to buy 20 pct of Lloyd's Wren.

text.p: Finsbury Underwriting Investment Trust said on Friday it has agreed to acquire a 20 percent stake in Lloyd's of London agent Wren.
Finsbury's relationship with Wren has implications for proposals by the Benfield & Rea Investment Trust (BRIT), which announced earlier this month it intended to acquire a minority stake in Wren.
BRIT at the same time has launched a 78 million stg bid for HCG Lloyd's Investment Trust, posting its offer document on Thursday night.
Finsbury said it had agreed to modify the terms of an advisory agreement with Wren to enable the agent to accept an appointment as Lloyd's adviser to BRIT.
The investment trust added it was considering buying further capacity on Wren underwriting syndicates. It has agreed to pay three million stg for the 20 percent stake.
The purchase is another example of how underwriters at Lloyd's are aligning themselves more closely with the recently arrived corporate capital providers.
